Other rewards may include an annual bonus, flexible work arrangements, and region\\-specific benefits.
 







**Unlock your Altus Experience!** 








 If you're looking to advance your career in data analytics, expertise, and technology for the rapidly growing global CRE market, there's no better place than Altus Group. At Altus, our work is purposeful. Every day, our employees drive impact, innovate, and shape the global commercial real estate (CRE) and PropTech industry.
 







 Our people\\-centric culture empowers you to deliver in a high trust, high performance culture, surrounded by an inclusive team that's collaborating to modernize our industry. We invest in our people with training and growth opportunities designed to propel you further in your career while providing a flexible and progressive workplace that reflects our values and teams.
 






 We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to drive the development and optimization of our Acquisition products from concept to launch. The ideal candidate is outcome\\-focused, with a strong understanding of product lifecycle management, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work cross\\-functionally to deliver exceptional products that meet market demands.
 








**Job Summary:** 




 We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to drive the development and optimization of our Acquisition products from concept to launch. The ideal candidate is outcome\\-focused, with a strong understanding of product lifecycle management, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work cross\\-functionally to deliver exceptional products that meet market demands.
 







**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Drive Roadmap Execution:** 
 Refine and detail product requirements in alignment with the product roadmap and vision, driving execution to ensure that key features and improvements are delivered on time and within budget.
* **Cross\\-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with engineering, design, and the line of business to ensure alignment, manage priorities and the product backlog; following Altus product management processes.
* **Customer Focus:** 
 Participate in user research and gather customer feedback exercises to drive product improvements, enhance user experience, and solve customer pain points.
* **Data\\-Driven Decision Making:** 
 Track analytics and KPIs to make data\\-driven recommendations that will enhance product outcomes.
* **Continuous Improvement:** 
 Monitor product performance, track user feedback, and iterate on features to drive continuous product enhancement.







**Key Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 3\\+ years of experience in product management or a similar role.
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills and ability to prioritize effectively.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience using product management tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, Trello).











**What Altus Group offers:** 



* **Rewarding performance:** 
 We are pleased to be able to provide employees competitive compensation, incentive and bonus plans, and a total rewards package that prioritizes their mental, physical and overall financial health.
* **Growth and development:** 
 As a destination for top industry talent, we're investing in you to meet the evolving needs of our clients and deliver on your professional goals. Our Altus Intelligence Academy offers over 150,000 hours of learning materials catering to diverse stages of an employee's career journey.
* **Flexible work model:** 
 We're modernizing our employee programs to reflect the new world of work. Our Activity\\-Based Work model provides you with flexibility to align your work location to the work being performed \\- office for connecting and collaborating, and remote for focused work.







 Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where all clients and employees feel welcomed, accepted and valued. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Project Manager-Siemens Real Estate (Midwest, East Coast, or Texas)
description:
Siemens Real Estate (SRE) wants you as our next Project Manager (Mid\\-West US Region). Are you wondering how we will work in the future. And how do we manage to put people at the center of this.
 



 How can buildings become the key to sustainable growth. And how can you save CO2 by collecting data. Then come to us, we look forward to receiving your application.
 



 Siemens Real Estate is responsible for Siemens' global real estate portfolio. Worldwide, we are responsible for 8\\.7 million square meters of office and production space at around 1,400 locations. We plan, build and design
 



 We operate and provide associated services. We are passionate about people, our planet and business requirements. We bring decades of experience and state\\-of\\-the\\-art technical know\\-how over the entire life cycle of real estate.
 



 We offer solutions for the transformation of our working world and for sustainable growth. You will need to be located in Midwest, East Coast, or Texas. As a Project Manager, your responsibilities would include, but not be limited to: Project Planning and Execution Develop comprehensive project plans, including schedules, cost estimates, and resource allocation.
 



 Coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure project milestones are met. Monitor project progress and adjust as necessary to ensure successful completion. Plan and manage technical projects, ensuring they align with overall business objectives.
 



 Coordinate Siemens office requirements for furniture, space planning, IT, security, and other cross functional partners. Engagement of and coordination with Siemens EH\\&S, Security, IT, and AV project managers. Coordination, ordering, and installation oversight of furniture and equipment for projects.
 



 Stakeholder Management Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, contractors, and other stakeholders. Facilitate regular meetings to update stakeholders on project status and address any concerns. Ensure clear and consistent communication throughout the project lifecycle.
 



 Risk Management Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies. Conduct regular risk assessments and implement contingency plans as needed. Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards.
 



 Execute local Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) aspects to minimize risks and ensure legally compliant operations, fostering a zero\\-harm culture. Financial Oversight Manage project budgets, ensuring costs are controlled and financial objectives are met. Prepare and present financial reports to senior management.
 



 Approve expenditures and ensure all financial documentation is accurate and up to date. Develop detailed cost estimates for various types of projects, including expansions, fit\\-outs, lease end dates, maintenance, and new locations. Develop and implement technical concepts/projects to reduce costs.
 



 Quality Assurance Ensure all project deliverables meet the highest quality standards. Conduct regular site inspections and quality checks. Address any quality issues promptly and effectively.
 



 Team Leadership Lead and motivate project teams, providing guidance and support as needed. Foster a collaborative and productive team environment. Conduct performance reviews and provide feedback to team members.
 



 Compliance Ensure adherence to construction principles, guidelines, and processes. Steer and ensure adherence to local building standards and regulations, including proper documentation and required permits. Portfolio Management Manage a portfolio of 15\\-20 projects, ensuring each project is delivered on time and within budget.
 



 Project Communications Develop and implement communication plans to ensure all stakeholders are informed of project progress and changes. Prepare and distribute regular project updates, reports, and presentations. Facilitate effective communication between project teams, clients, and other stakeholders.
 



 Address any communication issues promptly to maintain project alignment and stakeholder satisfaction. Basic Requirements: Bachelor's degree in real estate, Construction Management, Business Administration, or a related field. 7\\+ years of experience in real estate, with a minimum of 5 years in project management within commercial real estate or construction sector.
 



 7\\+ years of experience of successfully managing mid to large\\-scale projects. Proficiency in project management software (e.g., MS Project) with a minimum of 5 years of experience using it to develop project schedules and show the critical path. 7\\+ years of experience in commercial/light warehouse construction to include mechanical, electrical, plumbing, building automation systems, and tenant improvement projects
 



 Ability to read and understand construction drawings and specifications. 10\\+ years of experience in strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. 10\\+ years of experience using SharePoint.
 



 5\\+ years of experience with Microsoft Teams for collaborating across multiple groups. Ability and willingness to travel as needed for project site visits and stakeholder meetings. Must be authorized to work in the US without the need for sponsorship now or in the future.
 



 Preferred Requirements: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Solid understanding of financial management and budgeting. Strong problem\\-solving and decision\\-making abilities.
 



 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Certifications PMP (Project Management Professional) certification preferred.
 



 LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) accreditation is a plus. You'll benefit from: Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to our employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://www.benefitsquickstart.com/siemens/index.html The pay range for this position is $89,670 to $153,720 and the annual target incentive will be 10% of the base salary
 



 The actual wage offered may be lower or higher depending on budget and candidate experience, knowledge, skills, qualifications, and premium geographic location. Transform the every day with us. About Siemens: We are a global technology company focused on industry, infrastructure, transport, and healthcare.
 



 From more resource\\-efficient factories, resilient supply chains, and smarter buildings and grids, to sustainable transportation as well as advanced healthcare, we create technology with the purpose of adding real value for customers. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We value your unique identity and perspective. We are fully committed to providing equitable opportunities and building a workplace that reflects the diversity of society.
 



 Come bring your authentic self and create a better tomorrow with us. Learn more about our commitment to DEI here. Protecting the environment, conserving our natural resources, fostering the health and performance of our people as well as safeguarding their working conditions are core to our social and business commitment at Siemens.
 



 They are an integral part of our Business Conduct Guidelines and our corporate strategy. \\#LI\\-JE1 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.
 



 Reasonable Accommodations If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing a job application, interviewing, completing any pre\\-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please fill out the accommodations form by clicking on this link Accommodation for disability form. If you're unable to complete the form, you can reach out to our AskHR team for support at 1\\-866\\-743\\-6367\\. Please note our AskHR representatives do not have visibility of application or interview status.
 



 EEO is the Law Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here. Pay Transparency Non\\-Discrimination Provision Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.
 



 To learn more, Click here. California Privacy Notice California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.
 



 Criminal History Qualified applications with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with applicable local and state laws.

title: Supply Chain Systems Manager
description:
Neiman Marcus Group is a relationship business that leads with love in everything we do—for our customers, associates, brand partners, and communities. Our legacy of innovating and our culture of Belonging guide our roadmap for Revolutionizing Luxury Experiences. 
 

  
 
 Your Role 
 
  
 

 You will serve as a subject matter expert for MAWM end\\-users and representative of requests from Operations for system changes. You will benefit from NMG's Way of Working, which is a framework across all teams to work smarter, be present, and integrate work and life in a way that empowers you and others. You will work hybrid based at the Pinnacle facility and report to the Sr. Director of Engineering \\& Automation. 
 

  
 
 What You’ll Do 
 * You must be proficient in Pyramid Director and Lightning Pick applications
* You will comprehend messaging and communication between MAWM and Pyramid to troubleshoot issues related to the messaging.
* You will need to identify when a system issue ticket is required and follow proper protocol with Information Technology partners.
* You will, when necessary, pull team to identify issues, opportunities, create solutions, and implement.
* You will be the primary owner of the Supply Chain Intake process and correspondence. The scope involves initial triage of email inquiries, determining what teams are needed for resolution, managing all related correspondence in a professional manner.  Supply Chain Intake will include inquiries in terms of purchase orders through store and customer order inquiries.
* You must be able to travel 20% of your time to other locations as needed


 What You Bring 
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.  Able to build and present effective PowerPoint presentations.
* Adept in creating “How\\-To” documents.
* Analysis experience to utilize various data exports.
* Advanced Excel experience including lookups and pivot tables.
* Prior experience in warehouse management applications is required.
* Proven proficiency in the ability to manage multiple workstreams at one time and successfully lead cross\\-functional teams to resolution.
* Must be self\\-driven individual with 5 years of experience in system integration program management or business analytics.
* Ability to manage multiple email inboxes, including timely responses appropriately.
* Excellent written communication skills with the ability to create clear correspondence with parties of all levels including external partners.
* Ability and willingness to quickly learn new software applications.
* Ability to build/maintain relationships, internally and externally.




 Inclusive Benefits  
 * Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits, including wellness and healthy lifestyle support, for associates, spouses, domestic partners, and children
* Flexible Spending Account for eligible medical and dependent (day care) expenses
* Disability Benefits, including Short\\-Term Disability providing income replacement up to 26 weeks
* 16 weeks Paid Parental Leave, 2 weeks of Paid Family Leave, and Adoption Support of $10,000
* Paid Time Off, including 6 paid holidays, flexible time off for vacations and personal time, 3 volunteer days, and 7 sick days
* Retirement Savings Plan (401K) with NMG matching and $20,000 Term Life Insurance paid by NMG with additional voluntary coverage available
* Financial Solutions, including Credit Union membership, pay advances via PayActiv, tuition reimbursement, and scholarship opportunities
* NMG Associate’s Core Discount of 30% with multiple in\\-store opportunities for an additional 30% off across select brands
* NMG Matching Gift Program up to $2,000 to eligible non\\-profits, Hardship Assistance Grants up to $7,500 for Associates, and a volunteer opportunity hub through NMG’s All Heart Program
* Personal and Professional Development Opportunities with 16,000 online learning opportunities, including NMG’s Fashion Your Future, LinkedIn Learning, MasterClass, BetterUp, Connected Leaders Academy, 9 Associate Community Networks, and additional personalized learning experiences
* NMG Discount Marketplace featuring 1,000s of products and services with over $5,000 in savings
* For more information, please click “Our Benefits” section on our career site or reference the link here: https://www.neimanmarcusgroup.com/benefits


 About Us  
 
 As one of the largest multi\\-brand luxury retailers in the U.S.,with 3,000 of the world's most desirable brand partners, we're delivering exceptional products and intelligent services enabled by our investments in data and technology.Through the expertise of our associates, we deliver and scale a personalized luxury experience across our three channels of in\\-store, eCommerce, and remote selling.Our NMG\\|Way culture, powered by our people, combinesindividual talents into a collective strength to makelife extraordinary.Our brands include Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman.  
 

  
 

 We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.  
 

  
 

 As a woman co\\-founded, majority women\\-led organization outpacing the U.S. population in racial and ethnic diversity and led by one of corporate America’s few openly gay CEOs, Neiman Marcus Group is proud to celebrate associates from different backgrounds, experiences, and communities. We've made it a priority to cultivate a culture where everyone Belongs and where showing up as your full and authentic self is encouraged.  
 

  
 

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our Talent Attraction process. If you have a disability and need assistance or an accommodation, please email us at ApplicantSupport@NeimanMarcus.com.

title: Visiting Sr. Researcher, Pediatrics
description:
**WHY UT SOUTHWESTERN?** 
  

 With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas\\-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. As a world\\-renowned medical and research center, we strive to provide the best possible care, resources, and benefits for our valued employees. Ranked as the number 1 hospital in Dallas\\-Fort Worth according to U.S. News \\& World Report, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development to align with your future goals. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on\\-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more. We invite you to be a part of the UT Southwestern team where you'll discover a culture of teamwork, professionalism, and a rewarding career!
 



**BENEFITS** 
  

 UT Southwestern is proud to offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package to eligible employees. Our benefits are designed to support your overall wellbeing, and include:
 


* PPO medical plan, available day one at no cost for full\\-time employee\\-only coverage
* 100% coverage for preventive healthcare\\-no copay
* Paid Time Off, available day one
* Retirement Programs through the Teacher Retirement System of Texas (TRS)
* Paid Parental Leave Benefit
* Wellness programs
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Qualified Employer
* Learn more about these and other UTSW employee benefits!



  

  

****EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION****




 Ph.D. and no work experience required.
   

  

****JOB DUTIES****




 This position will develop and characterize genetically engineered mouse (GEM) models for NFl\\-associated disease models, including NFl\\-associated neurofibromas and MPNSTs. 
 


+ Develop and characterize genetically engineered mouse (GEM) models for NFl\\-associated disease models, including NFl\\-associated neurofibromas and MPNSTs.
+ Use a combination of histological, imaging, molecular and genomic approaches to characterize clinical relevance of our GEM NFl\\-MPNST models
+ Perform preclinical trials using GEM NFl\\-MPNST models to targeting cancer cells and abnormal immune cells in the tumor immune microenvironment.
+ Perform and demonstrate specific research lab techniques in molecular biology, cell biology, and tissue culture experiments.
+ Perform qualitative molecular biological assays using DNA/RNA extractions, real time PCR, and western blotting.
+ Quantify protein expression patterns utilizing different assays.
+ Analyze signaling pathways and mechanisms.
+ Perform more difficult scientific and medical research work in science area such as biology, chemistry, physics, or other related scientific field.
+ Record and evaluate data obtained from work assignments for use in scientific papers.
+ Collaborate with supervisor or other research personnel in preparation of scientific papers for publication.
+ Read literature and confer with supervisor concerning procedures and implementation.
+ Collects and organizes research data for project reports
+ Plan for, and provide working supervision to, work of Research Technicians or other laboratory personnel of lower grade; and
+ Perform other research duties as assigned and needed.



  

****SECURITY AND EEO STATEMENT****
  

**Security** 
  

 This position is security\\-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51\\.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information.
   

  

**EEO Statement** 
  

 UT Southwestern Medical Center is committed to an educational and working environment that provides equal opportunity to all members of the University community. As an equal opportunity employer, UT Southwestern prohibits unlawful discrimination, including discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or veteran status.

title: Senior Director, CPQ Modernization Leader
description:
Senior Director, CPQ Modernization Leader
 







 This role has been designed as 'Hybrid' with an expectation that you will work on average 2\\-3 days per week from an HPE office.
 






















**Who We Are:** 
































 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge\\-to\\-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today's complex world.Our culture thrives onfinding new and better ways to accelerate what's next.We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs.We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you.Open up opportunities with HPE.
 

























**:** 




    
 





 We are seeking a highly motivated and innovative Modern CPQ Solution Leader to join our growing team. In this critical role, you will be responsible for leading the evaluation, selection, implementation, and ongoing optimization of our CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) platform. You will play a key role in streamlining our sales processes, improving sales efficiency, and accelerating revenue growth.
 









**Key Responsibilities:** 










**Lead the evaluation and selection of a modern CPQ platform, including:** 





* Conducting thorough market research and vendor analysis.




* Defining and documenting requirements and use cases.




* Leading proof\\-of\\-concept projects and evaluating solutions.




* Participating in RFP/RFI processes and vendor negotiations.









**Drive the successful implementation of the chosen CPQ platform, including:** 





* Project managing the implementation process, including data migration, user training, and go\\-live.




* Working closely with cross\\-functional teams (Sales, Marketing, IT, Finance) to ensure a smooth transition.




* Configuring the CPQ platform to meet specific business needs and workflows.




* Developing and maintaining comprehensive documentation.









**Optimize and enhance the CPQ platform, including:** 





* Continuously monitoring and analyzing platform performance and user adoption.




* Identifying and implementing process improvements and system enhancements.




* Providing ongoing training and support to sales teams.




* Staying abreast of industry best practices and emerging CPQ technologies.









**Drive data\\-driven decision making, including:** 





* Leveraging CPQ data to analyze sales trends, identify opportunities, and improve sales performance.




* Generating reports and dashboards to track key metrics and measure ROI.











**Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including:** 





* Building strong relationships with sales, marketing, IT, finance, and other stakeholders.




* Collaborating on product launches, pricing strategies, and go\\-to\\-market plans.









**Qualifications** 
 :
 




* The ideal candidate will have a strong background in CPQ architecture, and end\\-to\\-end implementation and operations.




* Demonstrated success in leading and managing large\\-scale CPQ implementation projects, including program management, budgeting, and stakeholder management.




* Deep understanding of the Informatica platform suite, Salesforce, Oracle and other CPQ solutions and their capabilities, including custom built CPQ applications.




* Extensive experience in overseeing and executing all stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.




* Proven experience in leading and managing teams responsible for developing customer applications using Java stack technologies, ensuring high\\-quality deliverables and adherence to project timelines.




* Strong leadership and team management skills, managing in\\-house and SI resources.




* Experience in vendor management, contract negotiation and budget management




* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders across the organization.




* Experience leading enterprise\\-grade CPQ design, solutioning, and implementation.




* ITIL implementation experience.









**Education and Experience:** 





* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.




* 15\\+ years of experience, including 5 years in a senior leadership role.




















**Additional Skills:** 










 Accountability, Accountability, Action Planning, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Agile Methodology, Bias, Business, Coaching, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cybersecurity, Data Analysis Management, Data Collection Management (Inactive), Data Controls, Design Thinking, Development Methodologies, Empathy, Follow\\-Through, Growth Mindset, Implementation Methodologies, Infrastructure Design, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {\\+ 4 more}
 















**What We Can Offer You:** 











**Health \\& Wellbeing** 




 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
 







**Personal \\& Professional Development** 




 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have \\- whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
 







**Diversity, Inclusion \\& Belonging** 




 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
 


















**Let's Stay Connected:** 

























 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
 
























 \\#executive, \\#globalIT
 








**Job:** 



 Information Technology
 
**Job Level:** 



 Director
 




**States with Pay Range Requirement** 








 The expected salary/wage range for a U.S.\\-based hire filling this position is provided below. Actual offer may vary from this range based upon geographic location, work experience, education/training, and/or skill level. If this is a sales role, then the listed salary range reflects combined base salary and target\\-level sales compensation pay. If this is a non\\-sales role, then the listed salary range reflects base salary only. Variable incentives may also be offered. Information about employee benefits offered can be found at https://myhperewards.com/main/new\\-hire\\-enrollment.html.

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. title: QA Testing Lead
description:
**What we are looking for:** 




 Keurig Dr Pepper is looking for an experienced QA Testing Lead to join the team. The selected candidate will assist and lead testing efforts, ensuring the quality and reliability of software products. This role includes supporting and leading test strategies and overseeing the execution of test processes and plans.
 



  
 



 As a Test Lead, you will…
 


* Assist functional teams with the creation of comprehensive test strategies.
* Work towards quality assurance objectives and processes, monitoring and evaluating testing results against the predetermined objectives, and applying recommended actions for improvements on a single initiative or small components of multiple initiatives.
* Work closely with development teams to enable design testing strategies and integrate testing into the development process.
* Support testing (e.g., regression, functional, data validation, system integration, load, or performance tests) for new and existing functionality.
* Collaborate with testing teams to create effective test scenarios and cases that cover all functionalities and requirements
* Assist to define test environments and test data management processes
* Document and analyze test results and recommend corrective action
* Research, recommend, and learn to implement new testing technologies and practices, such as incorporating machine learning.
* Assist with the assessment of the effectiveness of the testing process and implement improvements.
* Support DevOps capabilities using continuous integration/continuous delivery toolsets and automation.
* Assist the program manager provide guidance, support, and training to test team members.



**Who you are:** 



* Proficiency in system development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies, including but not limited to waterfall, spiral, SAFE, agile, rapid prototyping, incremental, synchronize and stabilize, and DevOps.
* Demonstrated expertise in various types of testing, such as functional, performance, and other non\\-functional tests.

 The senior manager of information technology operations will play a critical leadership role, overseeing all technology operations, infrastructure, and systems. This role will also be responsible for

* **IT Strategy and Leadership** 
 :

 :

	+ Collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to ensure that IT solutions meet operational needs and enhance patient care delivery.
* **Compliance and Security** 
 :
	+ Ensure all IT systems comply with healthcare regulations (HIPAA, HITECH) and industry standards.

 :

	+ Ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and on budget.
* **Multi\\-location IT Support** 
 :
	+ Along with Star’s 3rd party MSP provider, provide IT support for 100\\+ locations, ensuring that each location has the necessary technology and tools to operate efficiently.
	+ Oversee the implementation of standard operating procedures (SOPs) across all locations for hardware, software, and network infrastructure.
	+ Work with 3rd party MSP to troubleshoot and resolve IT issues across multiple locations, ensuring minimal downtime and disruption to services.
* **Technology Innovation** 
 :
	+ Stay updated on emerging technologies and assess their potential impact on the business.
	+ Implement innovative IT solutions to enhance operational efficiency, patient care, and business growth
* **Asset Management** 
	+ Oversee requests for technology hardware
	+ Manage the purchase and configuration of hardware in conjunction with the IT vendor



 \\*Other duties as assigned.
 


  

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.
* 7\\+ years of experience in IT leadership roles, preferably within a Dental Service Organization (DSO), retail medical, or multi\\-location healthcare environment.
* Proven experience in managing third\\-party vendors, contract negotiations, and service level agreements (SLAs).
* Strong knowledge of healthcare IT systems, including practice management software (PMS),
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments and locations.
* Strong project management skills with experience managing IT projects in a multi\\-location environment.

title: Software/Hardware Quality Assurance
description:
**Must have AT LEAST 2\\+ years** 
 directly related work experience with aerospace/defense industry software processes (such as RTCA DO\\-178C, RTCA DO\\-254, SAE ARP\\-4754, AC 20\\-115D, MIL\\-STD\\-498, DI\\-MISC\\-80508B, etc.)

**Education:** 
  

 Bachelor of Science Degree is required in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or Computer Science or other related degrees.
 



 This position participates in monitoring every phase of the software development process to ensure design quality, making sure that the aircraft delivered software adheres to the standards set by the development company and satisfies regulatory requirements.
 



 Ensure compliance and quality of software development for airborne systems by verifying the development process adheres to DO\\-178C guidance and military standards.
 



 Software development lifecycle oversight by actively monitoring and reviewing all phases of software development process, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, integration, and verification to ensure compliance with guidance and standards.
 



 Experience in software requirements development, Software design, source code (C/C\\+\\+, Python programming languages), and verification is a great addition.

 Continue to develop your knowledge base through research, training, and hands\\-on experience.
 



 Embedded software/hardware verification background or knowledge.
 



 Demonstrated basic understanding of audit techniques along with the software development methods and software testing methods.
   

 Ability to interpret schematic drawings, specifications, contracts that will enable development and review of systems \\& software processes.

title: Warehouse Management System (WMS) Engineer
description:
**Warehouse Management System (WMS) Engineer** 
  

**Irving, TX (4 days onsite)** 
  

**Direct Hire** 
  

**Description:
   

 This individual will contribute to functional design and solution delivery for the WMS solution. As the Senior WMS Engineer, this person will be accountable for integrated technology delivery execution, driving continuous improvement of the WMS solution.
   

  
   

 Qualifications:** 
  

* **Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS), Computer \\& Information Science (CIS)**
* **6\\+ years of working with Blue Yonder / JDA WMS with at least 2 full\\-cycle implementations as an Engineer or Consultant (comparable experience with other best of breed WMS applications, in addition to BY WMS, may be considered).**
* **2\\+ years’ Technical experience with RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL), proficient in SQL.**
* **Strong understanding of Supply Chain and Warehousing concepts.**
* **Experience in Agile Methodology, and API based integrations.**
* **Excellent analytical, problem solving, design and development skills.**
* **Strategic and growth mindset, technology \\& process improvement experience, solution engineering skills and effective communication (written and verbal) skills.**
* **Ability to work in a fast\\-paced, team\\-orientated, collaborative, and cross\\-functional environment.**
* **Strong ability to design and execute configurations in Blue Yonder / JDA WMS to meet business requirements.**
* **Demonstrated ability of working with IT and Business stakeholders (incl. working with Distribution Center Managers/Associates).**
* **Retail eCommerce experience is preferred.**


**Responsibilities:** 
  

* **Analyze warehouse data: Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to warehouse operations, including inventory levels, order volumes, picking accuracy, and shipping/receiving performance.**
* **Responsible for WMS solution design and development for supporting warehouse operations and projects.**
* **Provide functional design inputs and lead effort to develop business process design, functional specifications, and test planning efforts, work with different collaborators to identify and address design gaps.**
* **Analyze code, configuration, data, and logs to find causes of errors and revise the solution as needed.**
* **Optimize warehouse processes: Identify areas of improvement within the warehouse operations, such as inventory management, order picking, packing, and shipping, and develop strategies to streamline processes.**
* **Inventory management: Monitor inventory levels, conduct regular audits, and implement measures to minimize stock discrepancies, prevent stockouts, and reduce excess inventory.**
* **Warehouse systems management: Oversee and maintain the warehouse management system (WMS), ensuring accurate data entry, system updates, and troubleshooting any system issues.**
* **Analyze, define, and document technical requirements for data, workflow, logic, hardware and operating system environments, and interfaces with other systems.**
* **Performance metrics tracking: Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure warehouse performance, identify trends, and report findings to management.**
* **Operational efficiency enhancement: Identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies in warehouse operations and propose and implement process improvements to optimize efficiency, reduce costs, and improve productivity.**
* **Cross\\-functional collaboration: Collaborate with various teams, including Blue Yonder / JDA team, Integration team, IT applications teams and Business teams to ensure seamless coordination and alignment of warehouse activities with overall business objectives.**
* **Support deploying software deliveries from Blue Yonder / JDA associates.**
* **Training and documentation: Develop and deliver training programs and documentation for warehouse staff on new processes, tools, and system updates to enhance their understanding and adherence to best practices.**
* **Support the definition of business and data requirements and support the development of functional specifications.**
* **Support development of test strategy and identification of test scenarios.**

title: Data Scientist
description:
***Role Overview:***




 As a Data Scientist at McAfee, you will work closely with our data engineering and analytics teams and our customer success team to profile, transform, interpret data, and build a comprehensive understanding of our support contact center. Your primary focus will be to dive deep into datasets, understand how they relate to business goals, and shape data to drive insights and business metrics. You will use languages like SQL, Python to extract, manipulate, and analyze data, and contribute to developing robust contact center metrics.
 



 In this role, you would focus on hands\\-on data profiling, transformations, and analysis. We are looking for a strong sense of curiosity, problem\\-solving ability, and a knack for working through data challenges.
 



 This is a remote position; however, you must be onsite at our Frisco, TX, office occasionally. We will only consider candidates who are a commutable distance to Frisco or Dallas and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.
 



***About the role:***



* Work with large and diverse datasets to profile, clean, and transform data for analysis.
* Build and refine data pipelines, ensuring data is structured and ready for analytical use.
* Use SQL and Python for querying, transforming, and analyzing data from various sources.
* Perform data profiling to understand data characteristics and uncover patterns and anomalies.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business metrics and ensure data aligns with key business objectives.
* Support the development of contact center metrics by integrating data from various sources and creating relevant attributes.
* Continuously explore and ask questions about the data to uncover new insights and drive better decision\\-making.
* Maintain clear documentation of data transformation processes and methodologies.



***About you:***



* Proficiency in SQL for complex data queries and data transformations.
* Strong experience with Python for data manipulation, analysis, and pipeline development.
* Hands\\-on experience working with large datasets, data profiling, and transforming raw data into structured formats.
* Familiarity with Databricks or other big data platforms is a plus.
* Excellent problem\\-solving skills with a curiosity\\-driven approach to exploring data.
* Ability to think critically and connect data insights to business metrics.
* Comfortable working with ambiguity and incomplete data, and can proactively seek solutions.
* Knowledge of data science concepts (e.g., basic statistics, predictive modeling, recommendation systems).
* Familiarity with cloud\\-based data infrastructure (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.
* Understanding of contact and call center operations is a plus.



 \\#LI\\-Hybrid
 



***Company Overview***




 McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.
 



***Company Benefits and Perks:***




 We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family\\-friendly benefits to all of our employees.

title: Cloud Security Architect
description:
Position is located in Phoenix, Arizona. Relocation benefits are available.
 



**About the Pay** 




 Note: The salary range listed ($125,777 \\- $150,904\\) reflects the HIRING RANGE and does not represent the full pay range for this position.
 



**About Central Arizona Project** 




 Central Arizona Project (CAP) is a 336\\-mile system that supplies Colorado River water to central and southern Arizona. More than 6 million people rely on this supply.
 



 CAP employs nearly 500 people who enjoy a team\\-oriented and safety\\-focused work culture. The close community of a small company is driven to help fulfill our extremely valuable mission.
 



**Compensation \\& Benefits Package includes:** 



* Competitive Salaries
* Arizona State Retirement System – Pension
* 401(k)
* Medical, Dental and Vision
* Life insurance, LTD, Short\\-term disability
* **4\\-10 (Mon\\-Thur) work schedule**
* **Option for part\\-time remote work after successful onboarding**
* Paid training \\& tuition reimbursement
* 9 paid holidays
* Paid vacation \\& sick time
* Wellness programs
* No benefits waiting period
* Relocation benefits
* Significant training and development opportunities
* Public Student Loan Forgiveness eligible employer
* 6\\-week paid Maternity/Paternity leave



  
 



**About the Responsibilities** 




 As a
 **Cloud Security Architect** 
 , you will provide technical thought leadership and guidance for technology teams on all matters related to cloud security from strategy to implementation. This critical role will report to the Enterprise Security Manager and partner with leaders across the business to develop and deliver solutions that meet requirements, support business strategies, and protect Central Arizona Project’s property and data, and ensure all cloud security tools (Azure, AWS, OCI, and SaaS) are in\\-scope as well as numerous best of breed technologies to fortify the layers of defense to ensure a secure enterprise with repeatable/automated processes that align with modern methodologies and best practices.
 



  
 



**Some of the specific duties include:** 



1. Designing security services in cloud\\-based programs based on pre\\-defined architecture frameworks and risk appropriate controls.
2. Collaborate with stakeholders, software architects, and DevOps teams to design and implement security solutions in Microsoft Azure, AWS. and OCI.
3. Collaborate with development teams to ensure secure coding practices, vulnerability assessments, and regular security testing.
4. Develop and maintain comprehensive diagrams and updated system documentation of the organization's cloud infrastructures, applications, and data flows.
5. Lead threat modelling and risk assessments to identify potential security threats and vulnerabilities. Develop and execute strategies to mitigate and address these risks.
6. Evaluate and recommend security tools, technologies, and services that enhance our cloud security posture.
7. Stay up to date with emerging cloud security threats, vulnerabilities, and best practices, and apply this knowledge to continuously enhance our security strategies.



  
 



**About the Qualifications** 



* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university with a technology\\-based emphasis plus ten (10\\) years relevant experience OR Associates Degree with 12 years’ experience OR High School Diploma or equivalent with 14 years’ experience.
* Experience in either cloud computing or IT security recommending software and other tools to protect company assets and conducting tests and analysis of procedures and systems to prepare for emergencies.
* Excellent analytical, organizational, time management, and problem\\-solving skills are essential, including the capture and mapping of the relationships between architecture components.
* Ability to collaborate with various teams while managing multiple projects at once.



**Required Certifications or Licenses (one or more of the following):** 




 Certified Information Systems Security Professional, Certified Cloud Security Professional, CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner, Microsoft Cybersecurity Architect, or Amazon Web Services Certified Security.
 



**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:** 



* Experience designing and implementing security solutions for cloud\\-based systems, including IAM, network security, data protection, DevSecOps and compliance.
* Ability to collaborate with various teams to develop policies and procedures.



  
 



 If you are experienced and highly skilled in the responsibilities of this job (mentioned above), have a team\\-focused positive approach to work, and are looking for a rewarding career with a stable organization in the North Phoenix area, then we encourage you to apply online today! www.cap\\-az.com/jobs. Your Water, Your Future! EOE
 





### About Central Arizona Project:




 Central Arizona Project (CAP) is a 336\\-mile system that supplies Colorado River water to central and southern Arizona. More than 6 million people rely on this supply.

title: Site IT Support (SIS) Analyst IV
description:
As a
 **Site IT Support Analyst IV** 
 , you will be responsible for providing day\\-to\\-day technical support to employees for a range of hardware and software related systems. You will respond to and diagnoses problems through discussion with users, which includes troubleshooting, fault rectification and problem escalation. You will provide effective and timely resolution of users’ problems, queries or complaints. You will assist in hardware and software evaluation and recommends upgrades or improvements to IT infrastructure. This is an onsite role at our Grand Prairie, TX plant and you will report to the IT Infrastructure Manager.
 



  

**Key Responsibilities** 



* Entry level position \\- Small Site(s) within country – day to day ticket resolution and fleet management according to standard KPI's. Typically supplements Site IT analyst at a larger site and requires constant supervision
* Onsite Technology Support provides in\\-person assistance to employee end users including:
* Responds to telephone calls, emails, and personnel requests for technical support.
* Provide support to end users on a variety of issues. Identifies, researches, and resolves technical problems.
* Maintaining and troubleshooting a range of user problems including PC hardware/software/LAN and voice network
* Diagnosing problem source through discussions with users and coordinating with internal IT organization support and operations groups and/or with vendors to resolve problems
* Acquiring, installing, and upgrading PC components and software and planning for/responding to service outages and other problems
* Performs pro\\-active monitoring of PPG’s computer systems through appropriate tools.
* Documents, tracks, and monitors problems to ensure timely resolutions.







**Qualifications** 



* A 4\\-year degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline.
* Strong interaction and interpersonal skills specifically listening, providing guidance
* Strong analytical abilities to quickly resolve technical problems, evaluate alternative approaches and to recommend the most feasible and economical solutions.
* Follow company standards and apply policies consistently.
* Strong verbal communication skills, including the ability to document operations procedures
* Availability to work rotating shifts and holidays
* A Fluency in English
* A driving license (B)







**To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3\\), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.** 








 \\#LI\\-ONSITE
